thread.title: Wings Clip Wounded Ravens

title: Wings Clip Wounded Ravens
text: Talk about it in the nychoops Message Boards BRONX, NY - Could St. Raymond win a semifinal playoff game against Wings Academy without their stars, Sid Wilson and Isaiah Washington ? The answer is "No", but the Ravens gave it one helluva try, falling short, 63-58. Frederick Douglass Academy III High School was electric on Tuesday evening. The packed gym had a regular season vibe and intensity as the two Bronx schools faced off against each other. Wilson and Washington were both sidelined due to disciplinary issues which gave some Ravens role players and newbies a chance to steal the spotlight in the semifinal round of the Tru-Ballaz Pre-High School Classic and pilfer they did. St. Ray's led 5-0 lead early off inspired play.The Ravens run would end, but impressive play by 6'3" Darius Lee '18 and Omar Silverio '18 kept the Catholic school out front, 11-2 with 2:07. Wings Academy closed the gap but Rays finished the quarter strong and led by 9 to begin the second quarter.The game moved at a frenetic pace and the question would be, could the Ravens keep playing efficiently at this tempo? The answer soon became evident as Malik Diallo '16 and Malik Mooving '16 pulled Wings to within 5 with 2:58 and an and1 by 6'4" Jose Perez '17 made the score 25-23.Wings soon took the lead as turnovers mounted for St. Rays and they were punished in the quarter, mostly by Boubacar Kamissoko '17 . At the half, the Ravens were trailing41-36 A seemingly reinvigorated St. Ray's began the second half as Lee and Silverio amped up the action. The duo pulled the Ravens within a point of the lead with 1:30 remaining in the third quarter. Wings Academy extended its lead slightly, getting some much needed breathing room but it was like breathing through a straw. The PSAL power only took a 48-44 advantage into the fourth and final quarter.Lee narrowed St. Rays deficit to a mere two-points with 4:11 and had a shot to tie with 2:45 but the sophomore went 1-2 from the free-throw line. Inconsistent shooting from the charity stripe would be a flaw which ailed the Ravens almost the entire game. To their credit, St. Raymond was unrelenting. Claudio Nmzei '16 and Silverio attacked the rim and finally put St. Rays back on top, 57-54. Wings calls time with 1:51 to strategize the final minutes. Perez scored for Wings and with 45.9 seconds left in regulation, Wings took a one-point lead. A Ravens turnover allowed Wings to increase its lead to 60-57 with 34.2. Lee closed the gap but Wings would hold on to win a tough one.Perez was the high man for Wings Academy with 19 points with Mooving and Kamissoko adding 15 points and 14 points respectively. St. Raymond was led by Lee with 19 points in the paint. Silverio contributed 15 points. The championship will take place on Thursday between Wings Academy and Iona Prep at 6:30pm at FDA III in the Bronx, NY. FEATURED PRODUCT
